intro: Aporosa misimana, commonly known as the Malagasy rosewood, is a tropical tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark wood with a rich, aromatic scent. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round berries. Due to its valuable timber, Aporosa misimana is also considered an endangered species.
